page.title: 01OVERVIEW OF THE TADLEY AREA
page.content: The area surveyed by Brimpton Women's Institute is on the Hampshire and Berkshire border, within the Reading - Newbury - Basingstoke triangle. Although not an area of particular beauty this is a pleasant, mainly rural area, but it includes the Atomic Weapons Research Establishment (AWRE) at Aldermaston and part of the urban area which has grown to house and provide services for the people there. This is the heart of "Nuclear Valley" since in addition to the AWRE, Greenham Common Airbase with its Cruise Missiles lies three miles to the west while the Royal Ordnance Factory at Burghfield is some five miles to the east. The area is in the forefront of the nuclear debate, but to the local inhabitants this is an attractive, comfortable and peaceful place in which to live in 1985.
